{"title": "The Lab: Bouldering Gym", "description": "A new bouldering facility at BCIT offering routes for all levels and abilities.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/recreation/the-lab-bouldering-gym/"}

{"section": "Schedule", "subsections": [{"title": "Hours (effective January 8 – May 16)", "description": "Closed all statutory holidays. Monday, Tuesday, Thursday: 5:00pm – 8:00pm. Wednesday (BCIT Students & Staff ONLY): 3:00pm – 8:00pm."}]}

{"section": "Rates", "subsections": [{"title": "Student", "description": "Rental Equipment: Free. 1 Day: $10. 10x Pass: $80."}, {"title": "Staff/Alumni", "description": "Rental Equipment: $3. 1 Day: $12. 10x Pass: $108. 10x Pass w/ Rentals: $135."}, {"title": "Public", "description": "Rental Equipment: $5. 1 Day: $15. 10x Pass: $135. 10x Pass w/ Rentals: $180."}]}

{"section": "Access", "subsections": [{"title": "Access", "description": "Open to BCIT students and staff during all drop-in times. Wednesdays reserved exclusively for students and staff. Alumni and public access on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday."}]}

{"title": "Research", "description": "Exploring the relationship between digital tools and social transformation through various research projects.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/centre-for-digital-tools-and-social-transformation/research/"}
{"section": "Technology, Individual and Collective Consciousness", "description": "Examining how digital tools affect individual and collective consciousness and behavior."}
{"section": "Agency in Technology Adoption and Use", "description": "Identifying challenges around agency, choice, and technological adoption, especially for young people."}
{"section": "Technology Design", "description": "Investigating design principles for digital tools that support health and education."}
{"section": "Technology Policy and Regulations", "description": "Exploring regulatory and policy frameworks that influence the design and use of digital tools."}

{"subsection": "Projects", "projects": [{"title": "Effects of social media on consciousness", "description": "Studying social media's impact on values and decision-making among young people in urban aboriginal families.", "lead": "Taban Behin", "period": "2020 – Present"}, {"title": "Language-learning technology and newcomer integration", "description": "Exploring how technology affects language and social integration for youth refugees.", "lead": "Leila Hedley", "period": "2021 – Present"}, {"title": "Digital tools and youth mental health", "description": "Assessing the impact of digital tools on youth mental health from a public health perspective.", "lead": "Sanaz Niagan", "period": "2021 – Present"}]}

{"title": "Commute by Bus & Rail", "section": "Overview", "content": "The hardest thing about commuting by transit is deciding what to do with all the extra time you have while relaxing on the bus or Skytrain. Say goodbye to taking the wheel in bumper-to-bumper traffic and hello to saving money on gas and parking.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/", "website": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/"}

{"title": "Commute by Bus & Rail", "section": "Basics for buses", "content": "Early Bird gets the Bus: Buses are sometimes early so arrive at least five minutes before the published departure time on the Translink website. Getting a Seat: Walking an extra block to a less popular stop might increase your odds of getting a seat. {"title": "Energy OASIS: Open Access to Sustainable Intermittent Sources", "description": "BCIT’s Energy OASIS project integrates photovoltaic panels and Li-Ion energy storage for Level-3 fast charge electric vehicle stations within BCIT’s Smart Microgrid system. {"title": "Commute by Bus & Rail", "section": "Overview", "content": "The hardest thing about commuting by transit is deciding what to do with all the extra time you have while relaxing on the bus or Skytrain. Say goodbye to taking the wheel in bumper-to-bumper traffic and hello to saving money on gas and parking.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/", "website": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/"}

{"title": "Commute by Bus & Rail", "section": "Basics for buses", "content": "Early Bird gets the Bus: Buses are sometimes early so arrive at least five minutes before the published departure time on the Translink website. Getting a Seat: Walking an extra block to a less popular stop might increase your odds of getting a seat. Know your Route: Planning your trip by looking up bus numbers, alternates, and departure times makes the trip more enjoyable.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/", "website": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/"}

{"title": "Commute by Bus & Rail", "section": "Save on Transit Fare", "content": "Plan ahead. Monthly passes and FareSaver booklets are just some of the ways planning ahead for your bus commute can save you money.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/", "website": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/"}

{"title": "Commute by Bus & Rail", "section": "Transit Etiquette", "content": "Move toward the back of the bus as soon as you board. Take the initiative to make everyone’s commute more pleasant. Take note of preferred seating for riders with special needs. Remove your backpack or bag and place it at your feet. On crowded buses, start moving to the exit a stop or two early.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/", "website": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/"}

{"title": "Commute by Bus & Rail", "section": "Basics for rail", "content": "Many Skytrain stations have separate platforms depending on which direction or line you are traveling. Look at the signs and make sure you are waiting on the right platform. Larger stations also have multiple exits.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/", "website": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/"}

{"title": "Commute by Bus & Rail", "section": "Resources & helpful links", "content": ["Translink", "Translink mobile site (including map view of your next bus in real time)", "Find a FareDealer", "Bikes on Transit"], "urls": ["https://www.translink.ca", "https://m.translink.ca", "https://www.translink.ca", "https://www.translink.ca"], "page_url": "https://www.bcit.ca/commute/bus/"}

{"title": "International Degree Completion Programs", "section": "Overview", "content": "BCIT offers business students the opportunity to complete a bachelor or master's degree in partnership with our international partner institutions. The following schools and universities accept credit and advanced placement for students who have completed a BCIT diploma or degree.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/business-media/global-relations/outbound-programs/international-degree-completion-programs/", "website": "https://www.bcit.ca/business-media/global-relations/outbound-programs/international-degree-completion-programs/"}

{"title": "International Degree Completion Programs", "section": "International Masters Degree Programs", "content": "Students that complete the BCIT Graduate Certificate in Global Leadership may enter the following masters programs: Coventry University (London, England), Fondazione CUOA (Vicenza, Italy), Ravensburg-Weingarten University of Applied Sciences (Weingarten, Germany), Rikkyo University (Tokyo, Japan), Ecole de Management Leonard de Vinci (Paris, France), Metropolia University of Applied Sciences (Helsinki, Finland).", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/business-media/global-relations/outbound-programs/international-degree-completion-programs/"}

{"title": "International Degree Completion Programs", "section": "International Bachelor Degree Programs", "content": "Students that complete a two-year BCIT diploma may receive advanced placement or course credit in the following bachelor degree programs: British Columbia Institute of Technology, Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA), Bachelor of Accounting (BAcc).", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/business-media/global-relations/outbound-programs/international-degree-completion-programs/"}

{"title": "International Degree Completion Programs", "section": "Graduate degree options", "content": "BCIT offers business graduates the opportunity to earn a graduate degree with one of our international partner institutions. BCIT Bachelor degree grads who wish to engage in graduate studies abroad are eligible to apply. The School of Business + Media will assist BBA and Bachelor of Accounting grads in applying to graduate programs in other countries.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/business-media/global-relations/outbound-programs/international-degree-completion-programs/"}

{"title": "International Degree Completion Programs", "section": "University of Applied Sciences BFI Vienna", "content": "The Master’s degree in International Banking and Finance at UAS BFI Vienna provides students with advanced skills and knowledge in international banking and finance. This program is available to students in BCIT Bachelor of Business Administration or Bachelor of Accounting program.", "url": "https://www.fh-vie.ac.at"}

{"title": "International Degree Completion Programs", "section": "University of Applied Sciences Upper Austria, Steyr", "content": "The Master’s degree in Global Sales and Marketing at UASUA – Steyr provides the advanced skills necessary for an international business career. {"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "Overview", "content": "Going abroad as part of your BCIT studies can be an incredible once-in-a-lifetime experience allowing you to broaden your horizons. This guide is intended to help you prepare for a safe and successful trip. Please make sure attend any pre-departure orientation scheduled by your program area as well.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "Key documents for international travel", "content": "Outbound student mobility involves crossing international borders. It is your responsibility to ensure that you meet all of the requirements and have valid travel documents to enter the destination country, any countries visited in transit (such as a layover in a third country), and to return to Canada.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "Passport", "content": "A valid passport is generally required to travel internationally. If you already have a passport, check the expiry date and note that some countries require a minimum validity of several months even beyond your intended stay. If you passport expires soon you may need to renew it before your trip. If you are a Canadian citizen, you can use IRCC’s tool to help determine how to apply if you need a new passport. If you are not a citizen of Canada, you may need to contact your country’s embassy or consulate to learn how to apply for a new passport.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "Entry Requirements", "content": "BCIT’s outbound student mobility opportunities are generally located in countries that do not require a visa for Canadian citizens. However, it’s always a good idea to double check the exact entry requirements for any country you plan to visit on your trip. If you are not a citizen of Canada, you must ensure that you have the necessary travel documents to enter any country you plan to visit on your trip and also to return to Canada upon completion of your trip. This may include a visa or an electronic travel authorization.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "Returning to Canada", "content": "Before you depart for your trip it’s important to ensure that you have the travel document(s) that you would require to re-enter Canada. Key travel document: Canadian Citizen: passport Permanent Resident of Canada: PR card Refugee: Refugee travel document Study permit holder: See the complete list of documents in our Travel to Canada Guide for international students If your key travel document is lost or stolen while abroad, you should immediately contact the nearest Canadian embassy or consulate for assistance. Non-Canadians should contact your the embassy of consulate of your country of nationality. Some limited exceptions may apply in rare circumstances such as emergency travel documents in case of a lost or stolen passport or PR card.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "Schengen area (Europe)", "content": "The Schengen area consists of 27 European countries. For information about entry requirements, visit: Canadian citizens, Do I need a Schengen visa? Note that for non-Canadian residents of BC, Schengen visa appointments are only offered at the Consulate of Switzerland in Vancouver. You can only book a visa appointment after your application has been submitted. Be aware that the earliest available time slot for a visa appointment may be several months away.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "USA", "content": "Canadian citizens generally do not require a visa to enter the US. Citizens of other countries may require either: a visa or Electronic System for Travel Authorization (ESTA) — for nationals of countries in the Visa Waiver Program. For more information visit: US Embassy & Consulates in Canada – Entering the U.S.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "BCIT International Travel Register", "content": "You must submit your information through the BCIT International Travel Register if you plan to travel outside of Canada as part of your academic program at BCIT. This helps BCIT leadership to account for and provide urgent assistance to any students or faculties abroad should any critical situation arise while you are outside of Canada.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "Medical insurance", "content": "If you’re heading abroad as part of your studies you should have BOTH: BC Medical Services Plan (MSP), and an emergency travel insurance policy (such as the BCITSA Health & Dental Plan).", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "BC Medical Services Plan (MSP)", "content": "Required for all students, in addition to one of the plans below As a resident of BC, you should be enrolled in BC Medical Services Plan (MSP). While MSP does offer some very limited coverage for emergency hospital care outside of Canada, it is generally limited to $75 per day. Therefore additional travel medical insurance such as the BCITSA Health & Dental Plan is necessary for any students going on an outbound mobility opportunity. See Medical Benefits Outside of B.C. for more details as well as forms relating to out-of-country MSP benefits.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "BCITSA Health & Dental Plan", "content": "For students in full-time programs BCIT students in eligible full-time programs may be enrolled in the extended Health & Dental Plan administered by the Student Association. This plan does have comprehensive travel medical coverage. For this plan to be valid, you must already be enrolled in MSP. Check Plan Enrollment or contact healthplan@bcitsa.ca if you are unsure if you are enrolled. For more information about travel coverage through the BCITSA Health & Dental Plan see: Plan Details, Emergency travel coverage booklet, Travel Medical Assistance Card (keep a copy of this with you when you go abroad). If you are not enrolled in the BCITSA Health & Dental Plan, you should plan to purchase your own medical insurance policy such as a Guard.me Global Outbound policy.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "Guard.me Global Outbound", "content": "For those without the BCITSA Health & Dental Plan Obtaining private medical insurance such as Guard.me’s outbound global policy is necessary if you are not enrolled in the BCITSA Health & Dental Plan. Your program coordinator will be in touch with more information if BCIT will be enrolling you in a Guard.me insurance policy.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}

{"title": "Outbound Student Guide", "section": "Post-graduation work permit considerations", "content": "(only for international students) If you hold a Canadian study permit and are considering studying a term or more abroad, you should be aware that it could have implications should you wish to later apply for a PGWP. The key point to understand is that only time spent studying towards your program in Canada may count towards the length of your PGWP. If you complete a program but didn’t study at least 8 months of that program in Canada then you may not be eligible for a PGWP at all.", "url": "https://www.bcit.ca/international-mobility/outbound-student-guide/"}
